title.narrative: H&N RESPONSE TO CRISIS AFFECTED PEOPLE

description.narrative: Girls, boys and mothers from crisis affected areas enjoy a proper lifesaving primary health care services, which contributes to Immunization, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls, boys, families and communities assessed with humanitarian needs due to crisis have access to goods and services in education, nutrition & health, child protection, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) and social protection to save lives and assist recovery through proven cost-effective participatory interventions focused on the rights of the child, and equity and gender considerations.

mailing-address.narrative: C/o UNICEF Amman P.O. Box 1551 Amman 11821

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)
Maternal and newborn care policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development
Measles and rubella supplementary immunization activities

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Girls, boys and mothers from crisis affected areas enjoy a proper lifesaving primary health care services
Newborn babies of conflict-affected families benefitting from newborn home services
Children 0 - 59 months vaccinated against Polio in crises affected areas through campaigns
Children provided with access to growth monitoring (nutrition screening) services
Under 1 year old children vaccinated against measles through routine immunization
